title: Strictly fans accuse BBC of harbouring 'vendetta' against Kevin Clifton after tour 'snub'
text:

Kevin Clifton has been one of Strictly Come Dancing's most prominent professionals since he first stepped on to the famous ballroom in 2013.

Since then, the Grimsby-born star has made it to the final every year, with a brief exception in 2017.

In the latest series, fan favourite Kevin suffered a major full from grace when he came crashing out of the competition in only week two with partner Anneka Rice, who his dad described as an 'absolute two left footer.'

But there was another shock in store for Kevin fans today when it was confirmed he would not be joining the show's annual live tour .

(Image: PA)

(Image: PA)

(Image: pixel8000)

While Strictly fans have never seen so little of Kevin, he will surely be glad of the chance to spend more time with current girlfriend Stacey Dooley, who he won the show with last year.

Kevin's apparent demotion in the professional pecking order has not gone unnoticed by some Strictly viewers who have accused the BBC of harbouring a 'vendetta' against him.

(Image: sjdooley/Instagram)

(Image: PA)

"Is there a vendetta at the BBC against Kevin Clifton ? Does somebody want him to get his ‘comeuppance' ... it certainly seems that way," tweeted one fan.

When Kevin's partnership with Anneka was revealed in September, another fired: "What a shame your pretentious execs chose to saddle Kevin Clifton with a no-hoper this season on Strictly."

Rumours were circulating that Kevin was disappointed to be teaching TV veteran Anneka, 60, this year because he wanted to be the first to complete the 'Strictly double' and win the show twice in a row.

(Image: PA)

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

Kevin slammed the allegations as 'ridiculous' and said he was 'very impressed' with Anneka as they progressed with their training.

But after three weeks of floundering at the bottom of the leaderboard, Kevin and Anneka were sent home - the earliest Kevin had left the competition in six years.

But more drama was to come as Kevin was overheard telling fellow dancers 'I told you so ' when the judges voted him off.

Insiders claimed to The Sun Kevin was 'humiliated' by the early exit.

"In his eyes he’s ‘King Kev’ – and he’s done phenomenal routines with his previous partners," they said.

“He’s got a friend for life in Anneka and he loved working with her. But this series is one he wants to forget.”

(Image: PA)

Fans were given another shock when long-term professional Kevin's name was not announced for the next Strictly annual tour.

The pros are hitting the road for a tour in the summer of 2020, but there are several big names missing this year, Kevin's included.

The news came as a disappointment for fans hoping to get their Kevin fix, with some venting their upset on social media.

Kevin passed up an opportunity to appear on the Strictly-themed nationwide tour in favour of a starring role in Burn The Floor alongside sister Joanne Clifton.

Mirror Online has contacted representatives for the BBC and Kevin for comment.
description: Strictly Come Dancing's golden boy crashed out of the competition in his earliest week ever this year
